usefulItems: cling film, large serving bowl, refrigerator
title: Salmon and Asparagus Rice Salad

ingredients.content: 2 lemons, thin peelings of skin only
60 g spring onions, cut in pieces (3 cm)
30 g fresh parsley, leaves and tender stems, cut in pieces
250 g asparagus, woody ends removed, cut in pieces (3 cm)

preparations.content: Place dill in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add sour cream, lemon juice, capers and salt then mix <b>5 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and place in fridge until needed. Clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic, 1 tsp salt, peppercorns and lemon peel in mixing bowl then grind <b>3 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then grind again <b>3 sec/speed 8<b>.
Add spring onions, parsley, 30 g lemon juice and turmeric then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Insert simmering basket, weigh in rice and water then rinse <b>30 sec/speed 7<b>. Add reserved parsley mixture to rice and stir with spatula until combined.

Place Varoma dish into position and weigh in asparagus. Insert Varoma tray, arrange lemon slices and top with salmon fillets. Season with ½ tsp salt and dill, cover Varoma then steam <b>20-25 min/Varoma/speed 4<b> until salmon is cooked.

Remove Varoma then remove simmering basket with aid of spatula. Transfer steamed rice to a large serving bowl then mix through steamed asparagus and remaining 30 g lemon juice. Flake salmon into rice and mix gently with spatula. Serve warm with reserved dill sauce.
